14966429: Corner Store Studio Apartment CBD/Hospital & Wifi

We have been travelling around Tasmania for a fortnight and had just endured a terrible crossing overnight of Bass Strait on the Spirit of Tasmania having not slept at all due to rough seas. 
Rebecca very kindly let us have access to the studio accommodation at 11.30 rather than 2pm so that we could get some sleep. On arrival, we loved the  studio immediately - it was very tastefully decorated and Rebecca certainly has a talent for interior design.  Her choice of colour combinations for the decor and furnishings was awesome.  The studio was spotless in all respects and we wanted for nothing. Rebecca had even turned on the air-con to ensure the place was cool for us which was very much appreciated as the day was around 31 degrees. Quality linen and towels were provided and ample supplies for a healthy breakfast including fresh fruit, bread, spreads, cereals, milk and plenty of tea, coffee, sugar etc. There were even home made biscuits to have with a cuppa. A variety of phone chargers was provided as was a cute hand made game of Noughts & Crosses!  DVDs and CD's were available although we did not use them. TV reception was great, free Wi-Fi provided, the bed was extremely comfortable and we had an awesome night's sleep - refreshed ready for our journey home to Sydney. We cannot praise this Air BnB accommodation enough - it would suit the fussiest of couples. We would love to have stayed a few more nights and explored Wagga Wagga - a good excuse to return in the future. Bravo Rebecca you have nailed it as a host.

We loved staying at The Greenhouse - such a gorgeous little space. It was the perfect location for me to attend uni while my wife worked from home. The internet speed was brilliant, and the access to Stan and Netflix was a great way to unwind. The little touches like the assortment of teas, coffee machine (and milk), bread and butter, and museli where very appreciated. 
Coming from Sydney, the train noises did not bother us at all but you clearly thought of others and provided ear plugs.
I will definitely reach out next time I am heading to Wagga!
Tim & Rachel

48357586:
Cassandra was an amazing host and the space was perfect! We stayed one night with our 5 month old baby and had absolutely everything we needed. The place was very clean and stylish, with lots of natural light and plants. The kitchen was stocked with milk, butter, bread, snacks and pantry basics like oil, salt and pepper, spreads, etc. The bathroom had lovely toiletries provided and a beautiful bath tub, and the bed was super comfy! Cassandra even provided toys for our baby to play with and extra towels for him (because babies = mess)! 
The location is good- walking distance to the centre of town, but is a bit close to the train tracks with freight trains going through, although the noise didn’t bother us at all. Ear plugs were available in case (literally she has thought of everything!) but we didn’t need them. 
Tv with Netflix was great and free wifi too. This place has it all and we’d happily stay again if passing through. 
Thanks for a great stay Cassandra! What a gorgeous little space you’ve created xx

I was in town for work. Deon's place met my needs. It was clean, reasonably priced, within walking distance of shops, was quiet and had a parking spot. The bed was comfortable. Deon responded quickly when I needed to get in touch, but gave me privacy the rest of the time. Check in and check out was easy. Deon kindly left some milk, cereal and bread for me. 
However, there were a few things about the property that made it less than ideal. There was an unpleasant smell, like carpet that took too long to dry. I kept the windows open during the days to try to air it out but to no avail. There were no screens on the windows, so I couldn't have them open at night because the bugs would come in. There was a hole in one of the windows that was fixed with duct tape. Some of the panels of the blinds were missing. The towel rack in the bathroom kept falling off. The toilet flush button kept popping out. The iron took it's 'auto cut off' function way too seriously, meaning it took me a long time to iron a shirt because I had to keep waiting for it to heat up again. All the foam from the ironing board kept falling out everywhere.  The water in the kettle turned brown when I tried to use it, so I microwaved water to make coffee / tea.

74692539:
Grant's house is lovely, clean, modern and in a fantastic location in Wagga Wagga, and communication was very quick and easy. However, I unfortunately did not have a great experience. 

I was staying with a group for my wedding, which I had booked over six months prior, and was fine at the time. I was then advised by Grant in the leadup to my check in that he had trouble with previous wedding groups in leaving a mess - and I needed to reassure him that we would treat the house with respect.

We ended up having my nephew visit the house, as well as 2 other adults, which I was willing, and did pay for post the booking. I understand that these guests were unexpected, and there was confusion (which was my mistake) about my nephew being in the house,  but I got an abrupt message from Grant on the morning of my wedding querying the child that had visited the house, as well as any other adults. I realised at this stage that we were being watched, and we found a camera at the front of the house, as well as the rear. These were unfortunately not listed in the House Rules. 

I completely understand that requirement for security, and that Grant may have had bad experiences with other groups, and that he had concerns about unexpected visitors (that I was willing to pay for). However I was left feeling watched, mistrusted and upset on the when we had the best intentions. 

I would recommend this house to others as it is lovely, however to be aware that your movements will be filmed and watched in real-time, and you will be contacted about them. 

Thanks Grant for having us stay, and I wish you all the best with future guests.
